question: Vapour pressure of a solution containing 18 g of glucose and 178.2 g of water at <katex>$100^{\circ}C$</katex> is: (Vapour pressure of pure water at <katex>$100^{\circ}C=760$</katex> torr)
explanation: Moles glucose = 18/180 = 0.1. Moles water = 178.2/18 = 9.9. Mole fraction of water (<katex>$X_{water}$</katex>) = 9.9/(9.9+0.1) = 0.99. <katex>$P_{sol} = P^0_{water} \times X_{water} = 760 \times 0.99 = 752.4$</katex> torr.
